TopicTitle: Part tools screwed my Unity up

Articles.Content:
So yea, jumped through the hoops of downloading that, whatever the hell it is, from the asset store.

Then jumped through the next hoop of pasting in the script that patches the, whatever the hell it is, from the asset store, even though I have no clue what to do with the script.

And then... I downloaded the new part tools, imported everything, seemed to work.

and now I have no 'write' button or browse button when I drop part tools onto a game object.

And, i have no part tools under the 'tools' menu to set the default path any more.

 

Edited September 4, 2017 by Fengist

Sorry to hear youre having trouble, Fengist...

Probably a dumb question, but you're using the newset PartTools, which is basically ust a single, dbl-click Unity package...And its installed...
 

I recently re-installed Unity and started from scratch, and this time was actually the easiest, most painless Unity/PartTools install I've ever done... (not that I'm an expert...lol)
Altho, yeah, installing the TextMesh from the store was kinda if-fy...

 

Edited September 4, 2017 by Stone Blue

Yep.  I've been through at least 3 part tools versions.  This is the first one that's screwed up.

 

Updating Unity, begrudgingly.  I've learned in the past when working with KSP, never upgrade Unity until excrements stops working.

*edit*

Yea, so for whatever reason I had to create an entirely new project in order to get part tools to install properly.

Edited September 4, 2017 by Fengist
